gist.headline: OpenClaw gets organized
gist.blurb: Setting up your favorite crabby agent just got easier. We've tidied up the landing page with tabs and a smoother connection flow.
gist.summary: The OpenClaw landing page now features a tabbed interface for installation instructions, separating fresh installs from existing agent setups with a unified connection step.
gist.impact: Users will find it easier to install or update OpenClaw thanks to the clearer, segmented instructions and improved readability.
gist.visual_concept: OpenClaw is represented by a crab mascot. The change is about organization (tabs) and setup. Visual metaphor: The bee and the crab organizing items into neat categories.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the cute bee mascot and a friendly pixel crab (OpenClaw) organizing digital shells into two neat piles on a sandy beach. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel gradient background. A retro monitor shows a clean tabbed interface. Chunky retro sprites, warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley. Text in pixel font: 'SETUP'. Nostalgic but beautiful.
